title: @Meddler or anyone working on Ashe: IE passive and Ashe's Passive
body: Greetings, a group of us were discussing Ashe in a thread, (great job by the way, I am EXCITE!) and we were wondering how does the 250% crit damage unique passive on IE interact with Ashe now that she cannot critically strike?

replies.body:
Effectively, IE effectively increases Ashe's Critical Strike Damage bonus by 50%. I've explained it in her PBE thread. Let me know if you have further questions about the math!

http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/6BBcWPLy-ashe-update-feedback-thread

she can, its just not guaranteed from her passive anymore, the passive does damage seperate from crit damage

Pretty sure she can't. Here is the quote from the news post:

"Ashe's basic attacks always deal bonus damage to slowed targets, replacing her ability to critically strike."

While in most cases your question is valid, there are a few circumstances where she will crit.  An ulting master yi, olaf, and anyone with black shield on them will be immune to slows and therefore critical attacks should apply normally.  

As for the vast majority of the cases, I would assume that it would increase the amount of damage her bonus damage does even more.
Interesting corner case, I will have to do a bunch of testing to see if it works that way or not. Sword of the divine would sure be handy right about now.
